page.title: 01Introduction to Arden.
page.content: The district of Arden is a rural area lying between Helensburgh and Loch Lomond on the B832 close to the junction with the A82. It is an area of fields, woods, rough grassland, hills and moorland, intersected by burns and the River Fruin which flows into Loch Lomond. The population numbering around 100 is scattered over the area in farms and cottages. The focal point is the school,beside which are Muirland Cottages. Life in the area depends on farming and tourism. The ecology is rich and varied. The game animals, mainly deer being a prominent feature. There are many birds and wild flowers in a variety of habitats.
